title: CUDA 9.2 PyTorch on Mac gives "Found no NVIDIA driver" error
body_html:
Issue description

Installed pytorch from the source with cuda enabled, but having issue (see below) when I tried to use it.
System: macOS Sierra (version 10.12.16)
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M 2048 MB Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB

Code example

$ python
Python 3.6.6 |Anaconda custom (64-bit)| (default, Jun 28 2018, 11:07:29)
[GCC 4.2.1 Compatible Clang 4.0.1 (tags/RELEASE_401/final)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

import torch
torch.cuda.is_available()
False
x = torch.Tensor(5, 3)
x.cuda()
x.cuda()
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
File "/Users/tesfaz1/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/init.py", line 161, in _lazy_init
_check_driver()
File "/Users/tesfaz1/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/init.py", line 82, in _check_driver
http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx""")
AssertionError:
Found no NVIDIA driver on your system. Please check that you
have an NVIDIA GPU and installed a driver from
http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx

System Info

$ python collect_env.py
Collecting environment information...
